fields_of_interest: Agriculture, Trade, Customs, Single market, Food Safety
eu_initiatives: Active through CEEV in several projects and activities; participation in the PEF wine pilot, in the Wine in Moderation initiative and many others
section: II - In-house lobbyists and trade/business/professional associations
goals__remit:
Unione Italiana Vini is the main Italian trade union for wine and spirits producers. It represents about 500 companies amounting to nearly 70% of the export value of Italian wine.  
The mission of Unione Italiana Vini (UIV) is to protect and assist in the development of wine producers, their products and their territories through the planning and implementation of innovative development models involving all levels of the supply chain. The aim is to achieve sustainable production and consumption from environmental, social and economic points of view. 
In order to achieve this, UIV has created a model based on an articulated and comprehensive system of services. Companies in the sector have been supported by the union, the information services and promotions and the laboratories and consultancy services for more than one hundred years (it was founded in 1895).  
UIV is also the owner and organizer of SIMEI (the International Enological and Bottling Equipment Exhibition). It is the WORLD LEADER in wine technology and the only international biennial exhibition presenting machinery, equipment and products  for the production, bottling and packaging  of all types of drinks. 
SIMEI is a unique international case history as the Association representing  visitors to the exhibition is at the same time the organizer of the exhibition of suppliers’ products.
relevant_communication:
UIV "area media" is based on the Publishing business unit and on the press office: 
PUBLISHING 
Unione Italiana Vini has devoted great attention ever since its foundation to the publishing field, with the emphasis on providing timely and constantly updated information at a high professional level. The UIV started publishing the Italian Winegrowing Yearbook in 1920, while ‘Enotria’ was first printed in 1921. In 1928 the very first edition of ‘Corriere Vinicolo’ was published, the sole weekly magazine in the field, which continues to be an irreplaceable source of information and an opportunity for comparison and debate among people in the industry.  
 
Il Corriere Vinicolo 
Each week Il Corriere Vinicolo tackles a wide range of questions on the current position on technical, economic and legislative matters in the wine trade, keeping a careful eye on international horizons. Particular prominence is given to technical and scientific research through the medium of special monographs, which week-by-week deal with the latest innovations in production in the field of vine cultivation and winemaking. Finally, with the aid of punctually-produced economic and market statistics, the Corriere Vinicolo is able to give its readers an up-to-date picture of trends in the sector. 
 
Corrierevinicolo.com  
The daily agency Il Corriere Vinicolo on-line has become a point of reference for the Italian wine sector. Every month about 15,000 users visit the site, and every week more than 6,000 professionals’ of the sector enter it to be updated in real time on the domestic and international market, on standards and regulations, dates of events, and detailed statistical data and information. On Mondays a newsletter is sent to a database of about 20,000 contacts, a unique property of UIV, which gives access to Il Corriere Vinicolo contents to both subscribers and free visitors. 
 
 
 
Vino in Cifre and Wine by Numbers 
“Vino in Cifre” is a collection of statistics about worldwide, European as well as Italian wine sector: vineyard surfaces, productions, wine consumption, import-export, production prices, the budget of the main Italian Denominations of Origin wine (Doc-Docg). Two editions of Vino in Cifre are produced yearly: at the beginning of the year and in occasion of Vinitaly (April). 
“Wine by Numbers” is the international edition of “Vino in Cifre” mainly focused on international wine trade. Tables and figures, quarterly updated of the import/export of the main Countries (Italy, France, Spain, USA, Australia, South America, Asia, etc.), with the trends of the last five years about bottled, sparkling and bulk wines. Wine by Numbers is a free PDF downloadable magazine, spread via newsletter to over 20,000 professionals all over the world. 
 
Legislative Codes 
The ‘Codes’ have been printed since 1975, and are offered as an enormously useful tool for companies and everyone working in the winegrowing field. In particular, the Vine and Wine Code brings together EU regulations and Italian legislation, while the Code on wine Denominations of Origin contains a collection of up-to-date production rulebooks. The ‘Codes’ are also on-line: always updated, easy to use, with fast search tools. 
 
Technical manuals 
As a result of collaboration with the French publishing house Eno-One, there is finally available in Italian translation a collection of technical and scientific manuals presenting the up-to-date position on the latest topics in the field of vine cultivation and winemaking. 
 
PRESS OFFICE 
Also active within UIV is a press office which is concerned with creating and sending out press releases to a wide database of people working in the field, including journalists, researchers and authorities.
